main event: Multiple UFO sightings were reported on 7th November 1951 over the Atlantic Ocean and northeastern area of Nova Scotia, Canada.
interesting points: A ball of light approximately 20 ft. in diameter was observed passing through overhead at high speed, leaving a trail of smoke and sparks. It disappeared from view in about 40 seconds.
A circular, metallic-like object was observed hovering and oscillating in the sky for approximately 5 minutes before disappearing.

A T-33 jet aircraft reported sighting a brilliant white, cigar-shaped object, approximately the size of a C-54 aircraft, at an altitude of approximately 25,000 feet. The object appeared to be motionless during the entire period of observation.

The object in the sightings was considered to be potentially a meteor, weather balloon, or an experimental aircraft, and despite thorough investigations, no firm conclusion could be drawn regarding its exact nature.
The sightings were reported and recorded in a timely manner, and the authentic nature of the sightings was acknowledged.
sighted object: circular metallic-like object, ball of light, and brilliant white cigar-shaped object
witnesses: pilots, co-pilots, and Air Force plane crew
